intro: Eremaea, commonly known as the spinifex grass, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Goodeniaceae, primarily found in arid and semi-arid regions of Australia. These plants are characterized by their low-growing, succulent stems and dense, fibrous foliage that helps reduce water loss. Eremaea species often form tussocks or mats, which provide habitat for various desert animals. They are well adapted to harsh conditions, with some species capable of surviving extreme drought. The genus includes several species, many of which are used in ecological restoration projects due to their resilience and ability to stabilize soils.
